answers.answer: HelloFirst. I apologize. I responed to your post promptly but it did not post. Anytime a patient has chest discomfort, it's very anxiety provoking. The fact that you're having chest discomfort could be for a number of reasons. You may have inflammation of the lining of your lung, pleuritis or fluid around the lung. That is to say that your bronchitis may have progressed to some type of pneumoniaeI would suggest that you visit the ER to have the symptoms evaluated. It is good that your risk factors for cardiac causes of chest pain seem to be minimal. that is, no cholesterol problems, hypertension diabetes and normal weight with good exercise toleranceEven though you are on antibiotics and taking them according to instructions, follow up to assess resolution of the mycoplasma infection is the most appropriate and safest course of actionGood luck and happy holidays

question: Hi -I am a 39 year old otherwise very healthy female w/no history of medical problems.  8 weeks ago I developed a horrible case of asthmatic bronchitis brought on by the mycoplasma bacteria.  I was in and out of the er for breathing issues.  Took Levaquin and then azithromyicin.  My md put my on Singulair and an Advair diskus.  During the process I lost 12 pounds and had a ongoing fever.  My md did a million blood tests, abdominal ultrasound, pelvic ultrasound, ekg, echocardiogram, stress ech and absolutely everything came back normal other than having the presence of the mycoplasma.  He did prescribe xanax to help me with anxiety for the bronchitis because I had never had breathing issues before and I was pretty scared.Now I am off all meds.  I have been off the Advair and Singulair for a week.  I have suddenly developed this pressure in my chest.  For a few days it was in the pit of my stomach right under my rib cage.  It felt like someone had their fist there.  I took Rolaids, pepto, etc w/ no luck.  Now the pressure and tightnes has moved up into my chest.  The tightness is pretty constant, but the squeezing of pressure seems to be intermittent.  I have tries taking Xanax and Aleve to see if it helps and it seems to a bit.  My question is this....I have had a million tests for my heart all great.  SHould I be concerned and making a trip to the ER?  This has been going on for a little over a week.  No pain, no other syptoms, just pressure and tightness.  Thanks so much for your help!  Tracy
title: Chest Pressure and Tightness
